bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ron Seeber is a Senior Vice Provost at Cornell University and a Professor of Industrial and Labor Relations. He received his B.S. in Industrial Engineering from Iowa State University in 1975. He attended the Institute of Labor and Industrial Relations at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, from which he received his A.M. (1977) and Ph.D. (1981).

Robert S. Smith, the Associate Dean for Academic Affairs in the School of Industrial and Labor Relations at Cornell University, is also a Professor in the School's Labor Economics Department. After receiving his Ph.D. in Economics at Stanford University in 1971, he taught at the University of Connecticut and worked as an economist in the U.S. Department of Labor before coming to Cornell in 1974. He has authored numerous articles in the field of labor economics and is co-author of Modern Labor Economics: Theory and Public Policy, the leading textbook in its field for 3 decades (and now in its 12th edition).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ronald Seeber and Robert S. Smith New York State Workers Compensation Pilot Program for Alternative Dispute Resolution Files #/4250. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
